intro: Hoya sogerensis, commonly known as the Soger’s waxplant, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and waxy, often variegated leaves. The plant produces clusters of star-shaped, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pink in color. It is a popular houseplant due to its ease of care and ornamental value. Hoya sogerensis thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
